name: Erfgoed Gezocht 1
description: The project consists of two stages. In the first stage, citizen examine elevation maps of the designated area where they identify possible locations for excavations. In the second stage, citizens can actually join and assist archeologists on their excavations.

name: Erfgoed Gezocht 2
description: The project consists of two stages. In the first stage, citizen examine elevation maps of the designated area where they identify possible locations for excavations. In the second stage, citizens can actually join and assist archeologists on their excavations.
organization: Leiden University and Landschap Erfgoed Utrecht

name: Erfgoed Gezocht Junior
description: Children between the ages of 8 and 12 examine elevation maps of the designated area where they identify possible locations for excavations.
organization: Leiden University and Rijksdienst voor het Cultureel Erfgoed

name: Grote Griep & Corona Meting
description: Continuation of the Grote Griepmeting, now also including corona
organization: Stichting Citizen Science and Science in Action

name: Zoönosenproject
description: Citizens take blood samples, throat and cloacal swabs of bird species in order for researchers to be able to investigate how the spread of viruses can be prohibited.
organization: Sovon Vogelonderzoek Nederland, Vogeltrekstation and NIOO-KNAW

name: Ik heb last-app
description: Citizens indicate how much their airways bother them and what symptoms they experience to provide further insights into the causes (and aggrevation) of respiratory diseases.

name: MyCardio
description: Citizens with cardiovascular diseases or citizens that are at risk of hart problems, report on their health to get more insights into the cause.
organization: Henk Duinkerken, Salut and Mijn Data Onze Gezondheid

name: Tekenradar
description: Citizens report whether they or their child have a tick bite, tick bite fever, a red circular rash (Erythema Migrans) and/or Lyme disease, alongside their age.

name: Grote Griep Meting
description: Citizens report when they or someone they know gets a cold or the flu.
organization: Kennislink, Natuurwetenschap&Techniek, NIBI, CWI, RIVM, de Digitale School, Kennisnet, Nijgh Versluys, NVON and NIVEL

name: Hooikoortsradar
description: Citizens report how much they suffer from hayfever at the moment of reporting on a ten-point scale.

name: Aerosolen
description: High school students help calibrate the measures of a satellite by measuring the amount of aerosols in an area of the air.

name: SMAP: bodemvochtigheid
description: High school students measure the soil moisture to help NASA calibrate its satellite that attempts to estimate this from a distance.

name: CREDO
description: Citizens help detect glowing pixels with the cameras of their phones to test one of the theories of what dark matter could be.
organization: Institute for Nuclear Physics Polish Academy of Sciences

name: Verdwaald in de Nacht
description: Citizens match photos made of places on the Earth in the night from space with the correct location.
organization: Cities At Night (collaboration between ESA and NASA)

name: WeSense
description: Citizens fill out short surveys about their perception of their current surroundings and wellbeing, who they are with, where they are, and what they are doing.

name: Zicht op Licht
description: Citizens report with the help of an app how dark it is in their surroundings and how much trouble they experience in their sight.
organization: UMC Grongingen and Weekend van de Wetenschap

name: CurioUs?
description: Citizens can go up to  the CurioUs lab to borrow measuring equipment and receive tips on how to use it. Moreover, the lab encourages the citizens to partake in different citizen science projects. For instance, the first project they took on was Onze Lucht (also on this list).
organization: Science LinX, Forum Groningen and the Aletta Jacobs School of Public Health

name: Personagebank
description: Citizens answer questions on the characters in the book they last read.

name: Shift-Diets
description: Citizens take part in the study of the RIVM to investigate what measures motivate young adults to change their diet.

name: Hooked!
description: Citizens listen to fragments of songs from the Top 2000 and click a button when they remember what song is played.
organization: University of Amsterdam, Meertens Institute, Sound & Vision, and Utrecht University

name: Kijk! Een gezonde wijk
description: Citizens install an app to report on opportunities to sport and play in their neighborhood
organization: Hogeschool van Amsterdam, RIVM, Gemeente Amsterdam Nieuw-West, Huis van de Wijk, EigenWijks, GGD Amsterdam

name: Straatpoëzie
description: Citizens report streetpoetry, poetry that is placed out in the open and can be read by anyone.
organization: Utrecht University and the Nederlandse Organisatie voor Wetenschappelijk Onderzoek (NWO)

name: Alle Scholen Verzamelen
description: Elementary school children partake in science projects and help gather data for research.
organization: University of Twente together with the other science hubs in the country

name: Zie Ik Spoken?
description: Citizens first complete an extensive questionnaire about who they are, what their sleeping habits are and whether they sometimes feel like seeing, hearing, feeling or smelling things that are not there. Then they play a game where they have to press a certain key when they see a specific item of clothing or hear a specific word in a movie. Finally, they receive a few questions about substance use (drugs and alcohol) and the project concludes with a hearing test.

name: Stemmen – Gronings (Nedersaksisch)
description: Citizens record themselves saying different words and take a quiz to determine what dialect they speak.
organization: Stichting Huis van de Groninger Cultuur, University of Grongingen and L√¢n fan Taal

name: Stimmen
description: Citizens record themselves saying different words and take a quiz to determine what dialect they speak.
organization: University of Groningen and L√¢n fan Taal

name: Nationale PlasticWatch
description: Citizens report litter to help Rijkswaterstaat gain insights on the origin, transport and distribution of litter.
organization: WaterLab (TU Delft), Rijkswaterstaat, Hogeschool Rotterdam and HZ University of Applied Sciences

name: Het Nieuwe Strepen
description: Special form of ‚ÄúKilometerhokken Inventariseren‚Äù. It works similar to that project, but now the area is searched by two citizens, independent from each other.

name: Opgemaakt samengevat en ingeklopt: notari√´le akten in Brabant 1743 - 1935
description: Citizens transcribe notary deeds from notaries from Brabant between 1743 and 1935.

name: In dienst van het Hof (1814 - 1940)
description: Citizens digitalize genealogical registers of the staff from King Willem I up until Queen Wilhelmina.

name: Hallo Midden-Holland! De bevolkingsregisters van Midden-Holland
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from Midden-Holland between 1825 and 1930.

name: WieWasWie - Bevolkingsregisters
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from Breda, Rotterdam and Maastricht between 1850 and 1938.
organization: Stadsarchief Breda, Stadsarchief Rotterdam and Regionaal Historisch Centrum Limburg (RHCL)

name: Wonen op Walcheren vervolg Bevolkingsregisters 1812 - 1900
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from Zeeland between 1812 and 1900.

name: Tags en uitleg
description: Citizens describe photos in the archives of the Maria Austria Instituut.

name: Met Oprechte Deelneming
description: Citizens help index scans of death certificates from Gelderland between 1951 and 1960.

name: Gezocht! Inkloppers van Brabantse gevangenisregisters 1821 - 1940
description: Citizens help digitalize the registration files from prisons in Brabant from the period from 1821 up until 1940.

name: Van de kaart: georefereren van historische kaarten van Stadsarchief Amsterdam
description: Citizens do georeferencing by placing old maps of Amsterdam over existing ones to determine their placement.

name: Toen-en-nu: Zet Noordwest-Holland op de kaart
description: Citizens do georeferencing by placing old maps of Noordwest-Holland over existing ones to determine their placement.

name: Het beeld van Groningen: Persfotobureau D. van der Veen
description: Citizens describe photos of Persfotobureau D. van der Veen from the sixties and seventies of the 20th century.

name: Oudste bevolkingsregisters van Nijmegen (1820 - 1850)
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from Nijmegen between 1820 and 1850.

name: Westfriezen Geregistreerd
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from West Friesland betweeen 1840 and 1930.

name: Surinaamse slavenregisters 1830 - 1863
description: Citizens index scans of slave registers of plantations in Suriname between 1830 and 1863.
organization: Radboud University and Anton de Kom Universiteit Suriname

name: Er zit muziek in de crowd
description: Citizens help digitalize music written for radio or television from 1930 to 1980.

name: Thuis in Terneuzen
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from Terneuzen, Axel and Sas van Gent between 1812 and 1900.

name: Diamantbewerkers Amsterdam
description: Citizens help index membership registers from the union for diamond workers from 1894 on up.

name: Tot uw Dienst!
description: Citizens help index retirement cards from people that have worked for the municipality of Amsterdam.

name: Officiersboekjes Nationaal Militair Museum 1811 - 1940
description: Citizens help transcribe books of officers in service between 1811 and 1940.

name: Bevolkingsregisters Amsterdam 1853 - 1863
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from Amsterdam between 1853 and 1863.

name: Compareerden voor mij
description: Citizens transcribe notary deeds from notaries from Westfriesland between 1843 and 1915.

name: Amsterdamse Doodsoorzaken 1854 – 1940
description: Citizens register the information on scans of cards regarding cause of death in Amsterdam betweeen 1854 and 1940.

name: Geef de Belgische vluchtelingen in Gouda een naam
description: Citizens help index scans of registers containing the information of refugees from Belgium that came to Gouda during WWI.

name: Nieuws! Lokale kronieken - 1500 - 1850
description: Citizens transcribe local chronicles made available by the Koninklijke Bibliotheek.

name: Duik in historisch Amsterdam
description: Citizens describe photos of monuments in Amsterdam so they can be digitalized.
organization: Stadsarchief Amsterdam and Monumenten en Archeologie (MA)

name: Waarvan Akte!
description: Citizens transcribe notary deeds from notaries from the Rivierengebied between 1811 and 1935.

name: Extra serie Amersfoortse bevolkingsregisters online
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from Amersfoort between 1860 and 1915.

name: Bevolkingsregisters Amsterdam 1864 - 1874
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from Amsterdam between 1864 and 1874.

name: Fotografisch Geheugen: de reportages van Fotopersbureau De Boer
description: Citizens link the photos on a camera roll sorted by subject to the descriptions provided by the photographers that made the photos.

name: Alumni KABK
description: Citizens help digitalize scans of cards containing the alumni and teachers of the KABK.

name: Meertens-vragenlijsten Taal en Cultuur (1931 - 2005)
description: Citizens retype written answers to surveys.

name: Bevolkingsregisters Amsterdam 1874 - 1893
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from Amsterdam between 1874 and 1893.

name: Maak geschiedenis: Zet Groningen op de kaart
description: Citizens do georeferencing by placing old maps of Groningen over existing ones to determine their placement.

name: Notaris van toen zoekt transcribent van nu
description: Citizens transcribe notary deeds from 19th and 20th century notaries from Tilburg.

name: Volgende Patiënt!
description: Citizens help index patient registers from hospitals in Amsterdam between 1818 and 1899.

name: Ja -  ik wil!
description: Citizens help digitalize registered banns from Amsterdam between 1602 and 1811.

name: Verlos Gelderse Geboorteakten
description: Citizens help index birth certificates from Gelderland between 1819 and 1912.

name: Holland Amerika Lijn Passagierslijsten
description: Citizens help index scans of repatriation lists of the people that were emigrated using the Holland Amerika Lijn between 1900 and 1969.

name: Captions for Cas
description: Citizens caption photos made by Cas Oorthuys between 1935 and 1975.

name: 80.000 minuten
description: Citizens transcribe notary deeds from notaries from Leiden between 1564 and 1811.

name: Militieregisters 1814 - 1941
description: Citizens help index scans of the people that once were registered with the military from the period from 1814 up until 1941.
organization: Archief Delft, Archief Eemland, Historisch Informatie Centrum,  Gemeentearchief Barneveld, Gemeentearchief Ede, Gemeentearchief Waalwijk, Het Markiezenhof, Het Utrechts Archief, Noord-Hollands Archief, Regionaal Archief Nijmegen, Regionaal Archief Zutphen, Stadsarchief ‚Äôs-Hertogenbosch, Stadsarchief Amsterdam, Streekarchief Land van Heusden en Altena, Streekarchief Voorne-Putten en Rozenburg and Tresoar (Friesland)

name: Het Vrije Volk
description: Citizens describe photos that have appeared in the paper Het Vrije Volk.

name: Wittebroodsweken
description: Citizens help index scans of marriage certificates from Gelderland between 1923 and 1942.

name: Bredase notarissen 1843 - 1905
description: Citizens help index archives of notaries located in Breda from 1843 to 1905.

name: AlleFriezen - Bevolkingsregisters
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from Friesland between 1850 and 1939.

name: Glashelder!
description: Citizens help index the old labels on microscopic glass preparations containing mites, springtails and other small organisms in the collection of Naturalis.

name: Geboeid door boeven! Inschrijfboeken van Brabantse Huizen van Bewaring 19e eeuw
description: Citizens help digitalize the registration files from prisons in Brabant in the 19th century.

name: Goetgevonden! Besluiten van de Staten-Generaal (1576 - 1796)
description: Citizens help transcribe the resolutions adopted by the Staten-Generaal between 1576 and 1796.

name: Regionaal Archief Nijmegen - Bevolkingsregisters 1850 - 1890
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from Nijmegen between 1850 and 1890.

name: Goed geregeld! Brabanders in het Bosch' Protocol 1501 - 1793
description: Citizens help transcribe scans of the Bosch' Protocol by name, location and event.

name: Crowd leert computer lezen
description: Citizens help train an AI to read old notary deeds by correcting the transcription made by the computer.

name: Hagenaars en Hagenezen - Bevolkingsregister Den Haag 1913 – 1939
description: Citizens describe cards with photos of families that lived in Den Haag between 1913 and 1939.

name: Vreemdelingenkaarten
description: Citizens register the information on scans of cards from Amsterdam between 1920 and 1970.

name: Bevolkingsregisters gemeentearchief Steenwijkerland 1826 - 1939
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from Steenwijkerland between 1826 and 1939.

name: Bevolkingsregisters Noord-Hollands Archief
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from Kennemerland, and Amstel- and Meerlanden from 19th and 20th century.

name: Dijken van Polders
description: Citizens add unto the already existing description of photos with events and people depicted on them.

name: Overgenomen Delen 1892-1920
description: Citizens help index the data from scans on people that have died or left Amsterdam from 1892 up until 1920.

name: Nieuws 2.0! Lokale kronieken -  1500 - 1850
description: Citizens help annotate transcribed Dutch chronicles.

name: Vele Voeten
description: Citizens help digitalize participant registers of the Nijmegen Four Days Marches in a public project (regarding the participants between 1921 and 1939) and a closed project (regarding the participants between 1941 and 1987).

name: Familie van je?
description: Citizens help index scans with data of the people that have lived between 1822 and 1859 in Veenhuizen, on the Ommerschans and in the colonies Frederiksoord, Wilhelminaoord and Willemsoord.

name: Utrechtse notariële akten (1780 - 1811)
description: Citizens transcribe notary deeds from notaries from Utrecht between 1780 and 1811.

name: Bevolkingsregisters Deventer 1811 - 1940
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers of the population of Deventer between 1829 and 1940, of Diepenveen between 1840 and 1939, and of Bathmen between 1811 and 1937.

name: Bevolkingsregisters stad Utrecht (1850 - 1889)
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from Utrecht between 1850 and 1889.

name: Zaanse Verpondingsregisters e.a.
description: Citizens enter in the names of landowners in Zaanstad from scans.

name: Oude Krantenproject
description: Citizens register the information on scans of the newspapers from the 17th century.
organization: Radboud University and the Meertens Instituut

name: Vele Ajacieden 2.0
description: Citizens describe photos in the archive of Ajax.

name: Zaanse briefhoofden
description: Citizens describe the information in letterheads of old letters from the 19th and 20th century from companies in the Zaanstreek.

name: Buitenlui: Geannexeerde gemeenten Amsterdam
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from municapalities that were annexed to Amsterdam between 1830 and 1921.

name: HISGIS Nederlandse steden 1832
description: Citizens help index scans of the old parcel registers of Limburg, Noord-Brabant, Noord-Holland and Zuid-Holland.

name: Kijk Je Rijk(er)!
description: Citizens help describe digitalize film fragments of Omroep Amersfoort between 1985 and 2011.

name: Bevolkingsregisters stad Utrecht (1900 - 1912)
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from Utrecht between 1900 and 1912.

name: Dagboeken Caspar Reuvens
description: Citizens transcribe the diaries of Caspar Reuvens.

name: Historisch Amstelveen in beeld
description: Citizens describe photos in the archives of Amstelveen.

name: 30 dagen op zee
description: Citizens help index scans of repatriation lists of the people that were passengers on one of the ships sailing from the Dutch East Indies to the Netherlands between 1945 and 1967.

name: HISGIS Drenthe kadastrale registers 1832
description: Citizens help index scans of the oldest parcel registers of Drenthe.

name: Kijk je Rijk!
description: Citizens help describe digitalize film fragments of Omroep Amersfoort between 1985 and 2011.

name: Adressen Bevolkingsregisters Stad Utrecht (1890 - 1899)
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from Utrecht between 1890 and 1899.

name: Vele Ajacieden
description: Citizens describe photos in the archives of Ajax.

name: Alle Amsterdamse Akten
description: Citizens transcribe notary deeds from notaries from Amsterdam between 1578 and 1915.

name: Bevolkingsregisters Regionaal Archief Rivierenland
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers from Regionaal Archief Rivierenland between 1820 and 1940.

name: Post van Weldadigheid
description: Citizens digitalize scans of letters between 1818 and 1847.

name: Pilotproject transcripties Statenresoluties Overijssel 1799
description: Citizens transcribe two books containing resolutions adopted in Overijssel in 1799.

name: Burgerlijke stand Breda: Wie nog meer en wanneer!
description: Citizens help complete the population registers of the municipality of Breda and some municipalities near it.

name: Missing Links
description: Citizens link data related to photos to data already present in population registers of Hillegom, Leiden, Leiderdorp, Noordwijk, Rijnsburg, Sassenheim, Voorhout, Voorschoten, Warmond and Zoeterwoude.

name: Westfriese Lidmaten
description: Citizens help index membership registers from churches between 1572 and 1913.

name: Tag de tekst!
description: Citizens tag names, locations and dates in already transcribed texts to train an AI to recognize those that were missed by people.
organization: Stadsarchief Amsterdam, Noord-Hollands Archief, Nationaal Archief and Regionaal Historische Centra

name: De bevolkingsregisters Voorne-Putten
description: Citizens help index scans of population registers of the population of Voorne-Putten between 1826 and 1939.

name: Dagboeken van schrijvers
description: Citizens transcribe diaries of Lodewijk van Deyssel, Henri van Booven and J. Greshoff.

name: Binnen- en buitengesticht van Zutphen
description: Citizens help index bedlam registers from the period between 1842 and 1938.

name: AirSensEUR
description: Citizens help measure the quality of the air by placing sensors.
organization: Joint Research Centre (JRC) of the European Commission

name: Luchtmeetnet Hillegersberg Schiebroek
description: Citizens place sensors in their backyards that measure the air quality.
organization: None, the citizens in the area started it

name: Vuurwerkexperiment 2019 - 2020
description: Citizens help measure fine dust in the air during New Year's Eve.

name: Vang de Watermonsters
description: Citizens take samples of water in lakes, canals etc. to measure the quality of the water.
organization: Natuur&Milieu, ASN Bank, Hoogheemraadschap van Delfland, Hoogheemraadschap de Stichtse Rijnlanden, Waterschap Brabantse Delta, Waterschap Amstel Gooi en Vecht, Hoogheemraadschap van Rijnland, Hoogheemraadschap van Schieland en de Krimpenerwaard en Waterschap Rijn en IJssel, Nederlands Instituut voor Ecologie (NIOO-KNAW), NWB Bank

name: MySense
description: Citizens place sensors that measure the local air quality. This project is special considering it entails measuring fine dust and gas in an agricultural context.
location: Region van Horst aan de Maas and Land van Cuijk

name: Weer & Klimaat
description: High school students measure the air pressure, temperature and humidity.

name: Delft Meet Regen
description: Citizens get a kit from the WaterLab which assists them in making their own rain gauge. Then, from the 18th of July until half September, they report every day how much rain has fallen.
organization: WaterLab (TU Delft), Gemeente Delft and Smartphones 4 Water

name: Papillottenproject
description: Citizens photograph, register and repackage papillots in new acid-free bags and store them in high drawers in a standard manner again.

name: Meetcampagne NO2 (Milieudefensie)
description: Citizens help measure nitrogen dioxide in the air by placing sensors around place that are important to them.

name: Maaspoort Meet!
description: Citizens living close to Maaspoort place sensors that measure the local air quality.
organization: The Things Network and the RIVM

name: Urban AirQ (Amsterdam)
description: Citizens help measure fine dust and nitrogen dioxide in the air in their street.
organization: Wageningen University & Research, KNMI, Waag Technology and Society, and GGD Amsterdam

name: OeverWatch
description: Citizens report on biodiversity and biological water quality. They also measure the chemical water quality.
organization: WaterLab (TU Delft) and Hoogheemraadschap of Delftland

name: Watermetingen door Mijn Omgeving
description: Citizens buy cheap sensors that measure the electrical conductivity of the water all day long.

name: WaterLab Circulair Water Flevoland
description: Citizens test circular water solutions in seven situations in practice.
organization: Gemeente Almere, the province of Flevoland, Vitens and Waterschap Zuiderzeeland

name: Visibilis
description: On the initiative of two citizens, a suitcase containing multiple measuring instruments was attached to a measuring location already in use. The goal was to compare different tools. The citizens have written  report detailing the results.

name: De Levende Bodem
description: High school students take samples of the soil and measure their quality.

name: Grip Op Water - Altena
description: Citizens report abnormal water circumstances. For instance, flooding or a place where the water does not drain.
organization: Agrarische Natuur Vereniging,, Gemeente Altena, Waterschap Rivierenland and AgroExact

name: Metingen 's Gravendijkwal (Rotterdam)
description: Citizens investigate how the emissions of hazardous substances on the 's Gravendijkwasstraat can be limited with the use of a hoze that spreads very small particles of water.

name: Boeren Meten Water
description: Farmers and the water board work together to gain insights into the current situation of salinization and subsidence.
organization: Wetterskip Frysl√¢n, Waterschap Noorderzijlvest, Hoogheemraadschap Hollands Noorderkwartier, provinces Friesland, Groningen and Noord Holland, TWTG, TU Delft, Van Hall Larenstein, LTO Noord, Projecten LTO Noord, Acacia Water, Fixeau and farmers

name: Samen stikstofdioxide meten met Palmes buisjes
description: Citizens measure nitrogen dioxide using Palmes tubes.

name: Plastic Spotter
description: Citizens spot plastic in the canals of Leiden and upload photos of it.
organization: Citizen Science Lab, Leiden University and more

name: Wadden Plastic
description: Citizens choose a flood mark on either the Wadden or North Sea beaches, follow that mark and report every ten meters their estimate for the number of plastic granules for an area of 40x40 cm.

name: Zet 'm op 70!
description: Citizens decrease the temperature of the water with which their house is warmed, from 80-90 degrees Celsius to 70 degrees Celsius for two months. They also place automatic sensors that measure the temperatures inside and outside. Lastly, they fill out a questionnaire regarding their experiences.
organization: WaterLab (TU Delft) and Warm in de Wijk

name: Hollandse Luchten
description: Citizens in Noord-Holland place sensors that measure the local air quality.
organization: RIVM, Waag Technology and Society, de Gemeente Zaanstad, Gemeente Haarlem, Omgevingsdienst IJmond, Omgevingsdienst Noordzeekanaal, TATA Steel, Smart City Haarlem, Buiksloterham Circulair, Studio O, Stofmelder and Brak! IJmuiden

name: Drinkable Rivers
description: Citizens sign in and pick up one of the test kits from one of the locations located all over Europe. The kits are used to collect samples of water and measure the water quality. Results are entered into a database.
organization: WaterLab (TU Delft), Li An Phoa (started it) and Dr. Renata van der Weijden (WUR)

name: Nationale Lichtmeting
description: Elementary school children build their own spectroscope and see what lamps are used in their surroundings.

name: SCOREwater
description: Citizens help investigate how the city of Amersfoort can become more adaptive to the changing climate, especially with regards to flooding as this is a problem in the city.
organization: Gemeente Amersfoort, Civity, Eurecat, City of Gothenburg, HydroLogic, IERMB, IVL, s::can, Talkpool, Universeum, ICRA, Swedish Hydro Solutions, Future City Foundation and Barcelona Cicle de l‚ÄôAigua.
notes_location: The Netherlands: Amersfoort; Sweden: Gothenburg; Spain: Barcelona

name: Snuffelfiets
description: Citizens measure air quality through sensors attached to their bicycles by cycling different routes.
organization: Provincie Utrecht, Civity, SODAQ and the RIVM

name: EyeOnWater
description: Citizens help classify rivers, lakes, coastal waters, seas and oceans based on their color with the help of an app.

name: Amsterdam Sounds
description: Citizens in Amsterdam place sensors that measure the amount and kind of noise.
organization: Gemeente Amsterdam, Ombudsman Metropool Amsterdam, Sensemakers Amsterdam, Sensing Clues and Waag Technology & Society

name: Explane
description: Citizens meausre the noise made by planes with their smartphones.

name: Check de Stadvergroening!
description: Citizens first register, alone or in a group, and then follow a step-by-step plan of what they ought to do. They inspect a place they choose themselves on what the soil consists of, and check the draining of rainwater and whether flooding occurs after heavy rain.
organization: WaterLab (TU Delft) and the Hoogheemsraadschap of Delftland

name: Samen Luchtkwaliteit Meten in Zuid-Holland
description: Citizens place sensors that measure the local air quality. This is mostly done in so-called "meetclubs", where multiple sensors are placed close to each other in cluster.
organization: Provincie Zuid-Holland, RIVM and DCMR Milieudienst Rijnmond

name: CHARRED
description: Citizens measure the amount of fine dust by putting sensors in their backyards.
organization: RIVM, GGD Amsterdam, Stichting HoutrookVrij and the Longfonds

name: Vuurwerkexperiment 2018 - 2019
description: Citizens help measure fine dust in the air during New Year's Eve.

name: Almere meet water
description: Citizens get one of the measuring toolboxes and measure the quality of the water in their neighborhood.
organization: Gemeente Almere, Waterschap Zuiderzeeland, knowledge institutions Deltares and Wageningen Environmental Research (WEnR), artist Pav√®l van Houten, Almere Stad & Natuur and Waterburgemeester Almere

name: Waterkwaliteit in Europa
description: Citizens first request research packages with which they collect a sample of water they send back.

name: Smart Emission Nijmegen Project
description: Citizens in Nijmegen place sensors that measure the air quality, the amount of noise, vibrations en meteorological indicators.
organization: Radboud University, gemeente Nijmegen, Geonovum, Intemo, CityGIS and the RIVM

name: Meet je Stad
description: Citizens measure temperature, humidity, air quity and soil moisture.
organization: Gemeente Amersfoort, Waterschap Vallei en Veluwe and Hogeschool van Amsterdam

name: Vuurwerkexperiment 2017/2018
description: Citizens help measure fine dust in the air during New Year's Eve.

name: iSPEX
description: Citizens help measure fine dust in the air.
organization: RIVM, NOVA, SRON and the KNMI

name: AiREAS Eindhoven
description: Citizens set up a project to measure air quality in the city of Eindhoven.

name: Oud & Nieuw 2020 - 2021
description: Citizens help measure fine dust in the air during New Year's Eve.

name: Samen Meten aan Luchtkwaliteit
description: Citizens measure airquality by putting sensors in their backyards.

name: Versheid van Water
description: Citizens help researchers use the new technique Next Generation Sequencing to determine whether water is a fresh product.
organization: Waternet and KWR Watercycle Research Institute

name: Vuurwerk 2016 - 2017
description: Citizens help measure fine dust in the air during New Year's Eve.

name: Luftdaten op Sensor.community
description: Citizens place sensors that measure the local air quality.

name: Geluid-​ en luchtkwaliteit
description: Citizens in Schiedam place sensors that measure the amount of noise and the air quality.
organization: Gemeente Schiedam, DCMR, Ministerie van Infrastructuur en Milieu and the RIVM

name: Jubileumproject DCMR - NO2 burgermetingen in Rijnmondgebied
description: In honor of their anniversary, the DCMR provided 230 citizens with sensors to measure nitrogen dioxide.

name: Waterlab Flevoland
description: Citizens test innovative purification systems for two years.

name: Onze Lucht – zelf fijnstof meten in Noord-Nederland
description: Citizens build gaugers that measure the amount of fine dust in the air. For every area with the same postal code in Groningen, Friesland or Drenthe, one person can partake in the project.
organization: RIVM, University of Groningen, GGD Groningen and Longfonds

name: Schone Rivieren
description: Citizens help researchers by cleaning up rivers and investigating what they find.
organization: IVN Natuureducatie, Plastic Soup Foundation and Stichting de Noordzee

name: Hoe gezond is onze lucht?
description: Citizens help measure nitrogen dioxide in the air by placing sensors around place that are important to them, like the local school or the street through which they cycle every day.

name: Een neus voor luchtkwaliteit
description: Sensors are placed in places in Maastricht that are chosen by citizens. The sensors measure the local air quality.

name: Samen Geluid Meten
description: Citizens place sensors that measure the amount of noise.

name: Boeren en Buren
description: Citizens place sensors that measure the local air quality and fill in an app regarding the smell.
organization: RIVM, Limburgse Land- en Tuinbouwbond, stichting Gezond Leefmilieu Venray, gemeente Venray and the province of Limburg

name: Spinnentelling
description: Citizens register on two predetermined days the number and kind of spiders they see in their backyards.
organization: Jaarrond Tuintelling, EIS Kenniscentrum Insecten, Naturalis Biodiversity Center and the Natuurmuseum Frysl√¢n

name: Oeverplanten
description: Citizens choose a strip of fourty meters alongside a shore. Every ten meters, they report all indicator plants they see and cross them out on a card. In the middle, they report the coordinates and afterwards they make a photo of the strip of land they examined.

name: Animal Tracker
description: Citizens localize spoonbills and report on them.

name: Plonzenweekend
description: Citizens count the number of splashes they hear when passing the pond in their backyard or another pond on a walk. If they are able to get close enough to see a frog, they can also count the frog species.

name: Special Project Muggenradar
description: Citizens send researchers the mosquitos they have killed.

name: Zomerganzentelling
description: Citizens count summer geese and report on their number and species.
organization: Koninklijke Nederlandse Jachtvereniging and Sovon Vogelonderzoek Nederland

name: Wantsen
description: Citizens make photos of the bugs they encounter and load them unto waarneming.nl.

name: Libellentelling
description: Citizens register how many and what kinds of dragonflies they have seen on two predetermined days. They also register whether they saw any dead dragonflies.

name: Nationale Waterdiertjes Telling
description: Citizens report which and how many animals live in the water in their nearby ditches. They also report the type and quality of the water.
organization: Wageningen University & Research, GLOBE, Ons Water, IVM Natuureducatie, NIOO-KNAW, Unie van Waterschappen, Stowa, Ministerie van Infrastructuur en Waterstaat and Watereducatie.
notes_location: Officially worldwide, but most activity is in The Netherlands

name: Paardenbloemen
description: Citizens collect blowballs of dandelions, and report how long and how wide the tails are. Then they go inside, select five achenes which they let go five times each and report how long it takes them to land on the ground.
organization: EvoScope (Gemeente Leiden, Leiden University and Naturalis)

name: Herbariummateriaal Verzamelen
description: Citizens collect samples of plants that are either rare, believed to have gone extinct in the Netherlands, plants with flowers or fruits that they are unable to identify or they want to argue a species can better be split into multiple species. After collecting the sample, it is send to a predetermined address.

name: Tweede Boerenzwaluw - nestentelling
description: Citizens count the number of new nests of the barn swallow in their own backyards.

name: Kikkerdriltelling
description: Citizens count the number of clumps of spawn in the ponds in their backyards during a predetermined period of time.

name: Stoepplantjes
description: Citizens report where and what plants/weeds they found on their sidewalks.
organization: Hortus Leiden, Nederlandse Vereniging Botanische Tuinen, Singelpark and Verwonder om de Hoek

name: Boerenzwaluw - nestentelling
description: Citizens count the number of nests of the barn swallow in their own backyards.

name: Mollentelling
description: Citizens count on predetermined days the number of moles or molehills they see in their surroundings.
organization: Zoogdiervereniging, Vroege Vogels, Waarneming.nl, Natuurpunt and Jaarrond Tuintelling

name: Snapshot Hoge Veluwe
description: Citizens count the number of animals and species present on a photo.

name: Constant Effort Site Project
description: Citizens help ring birds. What is different for this project is that it is all very standardized: citizens go every ten days, for the same amount of time and place the nets on the same places.
organization: Sovon Vogelonderzoek Nederland, Vogeltrekstation and NIOO-KNAW

name: Nationale Tuinvogeltelling
description: Citizens count on one of the predetermined days for 30 minutes the number of birds in their backyards and also report on their species.

name: Eindejaars Plantenjacht
description: Citizens count between predetermined days which plants bloom in their backyard.

name: Bioblitz
description: A contest where citizens try to discover as many animals and plants in their backyard within a 24-hour time period.

name: Wadertrack
description: Citizens register their observations of color ringed oystercatchers.
organization: Sovon Vogelonderzoek Nederland, NIOO-KNAW, IMARES and Rijksuniversiteit Groningen

name: SnailSnap
description: Citizens download an app with which they make pictures of snails they encountered from April up until October. The app sends the photo, along with the coordinates of the place it was taken at to waarneming.nl.
organization: EvoScope (Gemeente Leiden, Leiden University and Naturalis)  and EIS Kenniscentrum Insecten

name: Witte Gebieden
description: Citizens (mostly florists) reserve a ‚ÄúWit Gebied‚Äù beforehand. These are areas where florists are not as active, so there are less observations compared to other areas. Florists then visit such an area for a maximum of one day and fill in lists of what they found in the area that covers at least three ‚Äúkilometerhokken‚Äù.

name: Muggenradar
description: Citizens report how much trouble they experience from mosquitoes (none, a little, much, very much).

name: Kilometerhokken Inventariseren
description: Citizens register the locations plant species by crossing them off on a list in a predetermined area.

name: Van Kroeg tot Kraamkamer
description: Citizens observe the animals in their backyards for a predetermined period of ten days and note what kind of behavior they display (kroeg, hotel or kraamkamer).

name: Wildspotter
description: Citizens check whether animals can find their way at fauna passages by watching videos.
notes_duration: No indication when the project ended

name: Egelweekend
description: Citizens register when and how many hedgehogs they have encountered. Dead hedgehogs are also reported.

name: GrowApp
description: Citizens make pictures of a certain spot in nature, which the app transforms into a time-lapse to capture the change of seasons. The app sheds light on the impact of climate change on nature.
notes_location: Officially worldwide, but most activity is in The Netherlands

name: Nationale Nachtvlindernachten
description: Citizens count on one of the predetermined nights the number and species of moths they see in their backyard.

name: Avondtelling Amfibie√´n
description: Citizens report how many and what kind of amphibians they have seen and heard on a predetermined evening.

name: Tuinvijver-opschoontelling
description: Citizens cleaning the ponds in their backyards report on what species they encountered and how many of each species they saw.

name: Pullen
description: Citizens ring young birds to gain insights in the first year of life of their peers.
organization: Sovon Vogelonderzoek Nederland, Vogeltrekstation and NIOO-KNAW

name: Nationale Bijentelling
description: Citizens count on one of the predetermined days for 30 minutes  the number of bees in their backyards and also report on their species.
organization: Nederland Zoemt: Naturalis, IVN Natuureducatie, LandschappenNL and Natuur&Milieu

name: Paddenoverzetacties
description: Citizens (mostly in groups) report how many and what kind of toads they transferred.

name: Mijn Berm Bloeit!
description: Citizens choose between a predetermined period a road verge. Then, they register one hundred meter of road verge and stand still every ten meters to note the nectar plants that are within one meter of themselves.

name: Lijsters- en Bessentelling
description: Citizens register which fructuous trees are in their backyard and which birds make use of them.

name: Nationale NajaarsVleermuistuintelling
description: Citizens count on one of the predetermined days the number of bats in their backyards and also report on their species from sunset until they have not seen a bat in over 10 minutes. They also give information on where in their backyard they saw the bats and where they did not see any.

name: Meetnet Urbane Soorten
description: Citizens count birds and species three times per season, on top of the yearly separate counts.

name: CR-Birding Submit
description: Citizens register their observations of color marked birds.
organization: Sovon Vogelonderzoek Nederland, Vogeltrekstation Nederland and Dirk Raes

name: Boerenzwaluwproject
description: Citizens put in extra effort to ring barn swallows and thereby gain insights in the survival and reproduction of the species.

name: Natuurkalender
description: Citizens observe a certain animal species on a location they have chosen themselves and note the first day when they enter a new phenological phase.
organization: Wageningen University & Research, FLORON, RAVON, Sovon Vogelonderzoek Nederland, Stichting voor Duurzame Ontwikkeling, De Vlinderstichting, Vroege Vogels and Zoogdiervereniging

name: TreeWiFi
description: A project that was started by a citizen where bird houses measure the air quality. When the quality increases, you get free wifi in return.

name: Kauwtjes
description: Citizens report how close they can venture near a jackdaw.
organization: EvoScope (Gemeente Leiden, Leiden University and Naturalis)

name: Kruidenrijk Grasland App
description: Citizens make pictures with an app of different kinds of grasslands.
organization: WWF, RVO, Wageningen University & Research and BoerenNatuur

name: Kuikenteller
description: Citizens count the number of ducklings in a place near them and then follow them and report of their survival for the rest of the season.

name: Tuinvlindertelling
description: Citizens count on one of the predetermined days for 15 minutes the number of butterflies in their backyards and also report on their species.

name: Koolmezen
description: Citizens hang two fat balls outside during the winter, one with a weird object underneath and the other without one. Then they sit down for half an hour and count how many great tits (koolmezen) come to the ball with the weird object and how many come to the ball without it.
organization: EvoScope (Gemeente Leiden, Leiden University and Naturalis)

name: RAS: het "Retrapping Adults for Survival" project
description: Citizens focus on one bird species they decide on themselves and then try the trap birds in nets to ring them. When a bird was also ringed last year, this is noted. Together, this gives insights in the survival of birds.
organization: Sovon Vogelonderzoek Nederland, Vogeltrekstation and NIOO-KNAW

name: Leuke Vliegen
description: Citizens count the number and species of flies they see in their backyard by making photos of them. The goal is to collect information on five families of flies, to see how many there are and where. This information is used to determine which species are well and which are not.
organization: EIS Kenniscentrum Insecten, waarneming.nl, Nederlandse Entomologische Vereniging and the youthgroups of naturestudies

name: Fishing in the Past
description: Citizens identify fish species on paintings to gain information on biodiversity and commercial use of fish species throughout history.
organization: Leiden University Centre for the Arts in Society (LUCAS) and the Naturalis Biodiversity Center

name: Staat Deze Plant Er Nog?
description: Citizens search for rare plant species, guided by a map of where they were previously found.

name: Bodemdierendagen
description: Citizens count the benthic animals in their backyards, planters and on their roof if they happen to have a so-called green roof. They register to what animal group (out of ten) the benthic animals belong.
organization: Nederlands Instituut voor Ecologie (NIOO-KNAW) and the Centrum voor Bodemecologie

name: Essentaksterfte
description: Citizens report whether ash trees are affected by a fungus.

name: Signalering (Invasieve) Exoten
description: Citizens report the coordinates and abundance (surface they span) of invasive exotics classified as such on a list. Moreover, when a rare exotic is found, material can be send in for examination.
organization: KNNV, all PGO‚Äôs united in the VOFF, Waarneming.nl, Gegevensautoriteit Natuur, Koninklijke Sportvisserij Nederland and Team Invasieve Exoten (TIE)

name: Ring - MUS
description: Citizens report on the color-rings they see on birds.
